SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddToy
The AddToy class represents the functionality to add a new toy to the ToyList.
AddToyTest
Tests if toyList increases as toy objects are Added to it
Animal
The Animal class represents an animal toy that extends the Toy class.
AppDriver
This class represents the driver class for the Toy Management Application.
AppMenus
The AppMenus class provides methods to display menus and prompt user input for Romas Toy Store application.
BoardGame
The BoardGame class represents a board game toy that extends the Toy class.
Figure
The Figure class represents a figure toy that extends the Toy class.
InvalidPlayerRangeException
The InvalidPlayerRangeException class represents a custom exception for invalid player range input.
NegativePriceException
The NegativePriceException class represents a custom exception for negative price input.
Puzzle
The Puzzle class represents a puzzle toy that extends the Toy class.
RemoveToy
The RemoveToy class provides methods to remove a toy from a toy list.
RemoveToyTest
Tests if toyList decreases as toy objects are Removed to it
SearchBuyToy
The SearchBuyToy class represents a class that allows the user to search for and purchase toys from a ToyList.
SearchResults
The SearchResults class is responsible for displaying search results to the user.
SearchReturnTest
Asserting correct Toy return
Toy
This superclass represents the common attributes for Toys in the database, including serial number, name, brand, price, availability, and age range.
ToyList
A class that represents a list of toys that can be saved to and loaded from a file.
ToyManager
The ToyManager class is responsible for managing the toy inventory application.
ValidateInput
The ValidateInput class provides methods to validate and ensure user input is valid for various properties such as serial number, stock, age, classification, size, and type.
